oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Lt. James Blodgett, Co. E, 75th Ill. Inf. Regt., USA to sister Nan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lt. James Blodgett, Co. E. 75th Illi. Inf. Regt., USA, writes letter and sends it by driver going on a supply train at daylight to "Stevenson for provision." Writing from Chattanooga, he refers to troops being in the best of spirits, plenty of corn being available for the animals, the appearance of a picture of Chattanooga appearing in Harpers Weekly, a pleasure resort known as Summertown, and the taking of Confederate prisoners.
